newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Telebras tumbles sharply.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Telebras tumbles sharply.

text.p: High-flying Brazilian telephone holding Telebras SA fell further Friday on profit-taking and on news the company could see lower rates.

American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) in Telebras were off 11-1/2 to 124-1/2 in heavy trade. The ADRs were among the most active issues on the New York Stock Exchange and were also among its percentage-loss leaders.
Telebras, a darling of investors and a bellwether for Brazilian stocks, has fallen 45 points since July 10 and is up from a 12-month low of 69.
Traders said the ADRs had been weighed by comments Thursday from the company's director of corporate users that Telebras would cut its rates in response to competition.
"It's just an excuse to sell," a trader said. "There are some people with huge profits in Telebras ... and they are just locking in those profits."
Brazilian shares also have been shaken this week by fears that the reformist government could devalue its currency. Those jitters spilled over into other Latin American markets.
Traders said Brazilian ADRs also had been hurt by concerns that a financial scandal in the state of Alagoas could hamper congressional passage of economic reforms.
Sao Paulo's stock market skidded eight percent in early trade because of local selling, mostly from domestic mutual funds.

Hinting at a broader retreat from Brazilian markets, the Brazilian Equity Fund Inc fell 15/16 to 15-1/4. The Latin American Discovery Fund was off 1-5/16 to 18-3/16, and both were among percentage-loss leaders on the New York Stock Exchange.

The concerns over Brazil spread to other Latin American telecom ADRs. Telefonos de Mexico fell 1-1/2 to 50-3/8, Telefonica de Argentina dropped 1-3/16 to 35-3/8 and Venezuela's CANTV was off 1-3/8 to 41-4/16.
Despite the decline in Telebras, J.P. Morgan said it kept its outperform rating on the company. Investment houses Smith Barney and Morgan Stanley also called the drop an overreaction.

"We believe that yesterday's news reporting that Telebras is taking steps to make extra tariff cuts is dubious and that the share sell-off ... this news prompted was unwarranted," Luiz Carvalho, Morgan Stanley's Latin American telecommunications analyst, wrote in a report.
Among other ADRs, Dutch shares Royal Dutch Petroleum Co fell 1-8/16 to 53-13/16 and Unilever NV was off 5-5/16 ahead of the expiration of options.
ADRs allow U.S. trade of foreign shares.
